channel.title: [Pi] Unique Kill command
channel.description: I'm looking for a specific kill command I used to see on 508's. Instead of simply killing the person it actually dealt damage equal to their max hp, Which resulted in death. Unfortunality, my attempts have resulted in compiler errors. Can anyone help?

item.title: [Pi] Unique Kill command
item.dc:creator: @Helicobacter Helicobacter
item.description:
@Helicobacter wrote:

Thanks. Works perfectly.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Unique Kill command
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kill”)) {
try {
String playerToKill = playerCommand.substring(5);
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (PlayerHandler.players != null) {
if (PlayerHandler.players.playerName
.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToKill)) {
c.sendMessage("You have killed the user: "
+ PlayerHandler.players.playerName);
Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players;
dealDamage(10);
handleHitMask(10);
c2.sendMessage(“You have been smited”);
c2.gfx0(451);
break;
}
}
}
} catch (Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);
}
}

Try sumthing like that

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Unique Kill command
item.dc:creator: @Helicobacter Helicobacter
item.description:
@Helicobacter wrote:

Thats the problem. I’ve been trying that. I’ve looked at the method called Deal damage and I trry this.

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kill”)) {
try {
String playerToKill = playerCommand.substring(5);
for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName
.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToKill)) {
c.sendMessage("You have killed the user: "
+ PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName);
Client c2 = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[i];
c2.dealDamage(99);
c2.sendMessage(“You have been smited”);
c2.gfx0(451);
break;
}
}
}
} catch (Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);
}
}

But it still does no damage. I actually did the deal damage Command to an previous one and it divided hp by 10 successfully…But it didn’t actually show any hits. And when I try to get it to do equal to hp it just doens’t do anything anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Unique Kill command
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Uhm i don’t have any experience with this but it sounds pretty simple to me.
Just look what overload does of you drink it and add the removehp thing to the command.
Easy as that i quess.
Il maybe can make it for you when i get home.
